Posts.Content: Have you had a hysterectomy?  What if you did that?  I chose to have the hysterectomy for 2 reasons.  One is that my mother was diagnosed with ovarian cancer and even though both our gene tests were negative, my doc and I  felt there was some coorlation to our cancers.  2nd is that I didn't want to take the tamoxifen.  Too many other side effects.   I am surprised your doctor gave you tamoxifen. I thought it was for pre menapausal  women?   I had the lumpectomy too.  I didn't want to take the aromatase inhibitors so I didn't. I did, however, change my lifestyle - I eat healthy, exercise and such so to avoid a recurrence.  THere are no studies out there for women who choose to take aromatase inhibitors and those who don't so why take them if there are no studies to tell me it works?   Good luck.
Posts.Title: aromasin side affects

Posts.Content: I would get a 2nd opinion.  I would want that thing biopsied.
Posts.Title: So what advice do you have about my 'biopsy" or lack there of...

Posts.Content: Nicole - I am glad to help.  I wish you were in my state as I could physically help you but I don't know where you are.  My advice is to contact www.breastcancer.org and see if there is a support group in your area.  You need a support group.   You might want to take a break from school so you can be of more help.  It sounds as if the stress is getting to you too.   Be there for her and make her comfortable.  Let her teach you the business so you know it and if you decide to continue the business, do so or you can decide how you want to handle that later. Don't bottle up those feelings. It will eat at you and isn't healthy.  Reach out to others.  Again, a support group would be the best thing for you.   It is hard I know.  I am betting it felt better just to type out how you feel. Feel free to continue. You need to get that all out.  Much love and hugs to you.  Oh do you have facebook?  check out facebook/Mojo.  He brings smiles to those who are going through treatment.
Posts.Title: Lost, Alone, and in Need of Advice

Posts.Content: Have you looked into Mexico?  They have an alternative treatment using mass doses of vitamin c with some other alternative meds.
Posts.Title: stage iv help

Posts.Content: No, I don't have any contact information but I would just search the internet and see what you find.  Also have heard of vitamin C through IV - liposomal.   http://cancercompassalternateroute.com/therapies/vitamin-c/
Posts.Title: stage iv help

Posts.Content: MD anderson is a great place I hear.  Good luck with it.  sounds as if bilateral mastectomy might be a good option.  I was 44 when diagnosed. I chose lumpectomy, radiation, chemo, and a hysterectomy.  It's all done as of December.  A long road but you will see the light at the end of the tunnel.  Hang in there!   Much love your way!  Keep in touch Ann!
Posts.Title: Swedish lady, 46yrs old, are you at the MD Andersson?

Posts.Content: Sooooo glad to hear!  Awesome!!!
Posts.Title: mammogram

Posts.Content: you have a very warped mind.  They do not increase the risk of breast cancer.  get off the forum regarding breast cancer.  your responses like this only upset the many thousands and thousands of women who have breast cancer that was detected via mammogram.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer help...

Posts.Content: I hope that your results were good.  I know the feeling.  I had my 6  month follow up exam and  I was scared too.  I think it is natural to be scared of any tests now.  I think it will get less scary as the years go by.  I have my one year in a few months and I dread it so badly.
Posts.Title: mammogram

Posts.Content: I am not an arrogant moron.  I am a cancer survivor who found out they had cancer from a mammogram.  I don't see how the mammogram gave me cancer within the 15 mins I was using it.   This board is not for cancer survivors - it seems to be for people like you who want to sell dr coldwell.  I've never heard of him and his website is a site soliciting for speaking engagements and his book.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer help...

Posts.Content: GET OFF THIS FORUM.  If you are going to say mammograms are a waste of time you need to find some place else for your discussions.  I've never heard of this "famous" doctor and besides ONE doctor says it and 50 million other dont???
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer help...

Posts.Content: I am not an arrogant moron.  I am a cancer survivor who found out they had cancer from a mammogram.  I don't see how the mammogram gave me cancer within the 15 mins I was using it.   This board is not for cancer survivors - it seems to be for people like you who want to sell dr coldwell.  I've never heard of him and his website is a site soliciting for speaking engagements and his book.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer help...

Posts.Content: You need to go somewhere else and stop your brainwashing nonsense. Dont give these women your garbage. This doc is just trying to make money selling his schemes and books.
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer help...

Posts.Content: so you had a biopsy on the left and it was positive?  Have you started any treatment yet?  Had lumpectomy?  Now there's talk of one on the right.  Not sure if it's positve.  Bilateril will certainly take care of the lump on the right.  Yes it can have your head spinning for sure.   I know it's hard because you have decisions to make.  Has chemo been discussed?  What stage was the other one?  Did you have any lymph nodes removed?   Hang in there.  I am holding your hand (virtually!)
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: NSTF13 - good luck with your surgery.  You will have a drain tube or 2 when it's done.  I hope the lymph nodes come back negative. fingers crossed and toes crossed and saying a prayer. Keep us updated on your recovery!
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: I had biopsy done and was told it was stage 0 or 1.  I had the surgery for the lumpectomy and the same time I had the dye put in to check the lymph nodes.  I had 1 positive that had metastasized so it became a stage 2b and because i had 2 tumors. One was DCIS  and the other LDC.  The doc will have the lymph nodes checked right away with pathology so you know right after surgery.  From then it was getting a few opinions to see if i needed chemotherapy. I also took the onco type DX testing which is typically done if NO lymph nodes were involved but I did it anyway. The test will tell you if chemo would even be necessary.  It came back low but with the lymph node being involved, I had chemo. Oh , I did have the IORT at CTCA so i didn't have to have the radiation afterwards.
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: I had 27 lymph nodes removed. 1 was positive and had metasasized and the other was negative
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: A 2nd biopsy?  So did the surgeon do a biopsy before?  Rather than having them do a biopsy and then the lumpectomy, I would have them do the lumpectomy.  Just my opinion.  I base it on sticking a needle in the tissue and pull the needle out.  What cells could be on that needle as it is pulled out?  The less that the docs have to touch the effected area, the better chances it doesn't spread.   I wish you the best of luck.
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: I hope all goes well today!  Love the footie PJ!  I wore a hot pink jogging suit and carried my colored stuffed frog named mojo with me!
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: Hi imoyer.  I am excited that my hair is starting to grow back too!  It's dark and curly and was light and straight!  LOL   Regarding the weight gain, I gained prob about 5 lbs.  I continued to eat healthy and go to the gym so I think that helped me from gaining too much. I had to do the steroids but when I did the first big dose of it and knew I woudln't get sick, I had the doc dose down each time until i was taking 5 mg of it.  I just dealt with the nausea with the good meds!   It's all tough you know?  I had just a few friends that would come by but mostly did this on my own.  Maybe that is what made me so tough!  LOL  who knows!   I know that this has changed me and I take nothing or no one for granted.  I also give my time and what I can to several breast cancer orgs.  I also started a facebook page - facebook/Mojo.  He brings smiles to those who are in treatment.  Hang in there!  Huggs and love your way!
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: Hasn't happened to me but if I were you, I would get a 2nd opinion.
Posts.Title: very confused about stage 4 bc

Posts.Content: I am doing great!  Had surgery, radiation, chemo, and a full hysterectomy and I am in remission!  :-)))))
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: Well I went to CTCA and was candidate for the IORT so I did the IORT at time of surgery.  He found a positive lymph node that had matastisised so we went to the 4 rounds of AC and 12 rounds of Taxol.  After that, I had a hysterectomy.  I finished all the above in December.  I have slowly gotten more energy back.  I hear the radiation can make you tired.  I am getting energy back now!  I just went hiking in the grand canyon last week and it was awesome!   Hang in there Lori!  You can do it!  Huggs!   Sheryl
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: Yes I did trim my hair as the ends clearly showed "fried" with the chemo.  I think it's taking its time growing back though.  Yes you sound very tough and God bless you with good health here on out as well!
Posts.Title: What next....

Posts.Content: Yes I did trim my hair as the ends clearly showed "fried" with the chemo.  I think it's taking its time growing back though.  Yes you sound very tough and God bless you with good health here on out as well!
